docs.abstract: DACCA, Bangladesh, Aug. 25 (AP)-- The rivers receded in most of the flooded areas of Bangladesh today, but a shortage of drinking water caused an outbreak of intestinal diseases. In the capital, water levels rose; large areas of suburban Dacca remained submerged.

DACCA, Bangladesh, Sept. 30 (Reuters) The recent floods that affected more than 10 million people in 12 northwestern districts of Bangladesh killed 655 people, according to official statistics published today.

DACCA, Bangladesh, Nov. 16 (Reuters)--At least 40 people, including 15 policemen, were injured today in a clash between soccer fans and policemen after a game was canceled, the official Bangladesh press agency said. It said that the game, in the southern city of Chittagong, had to be abandoned because of "procedural difficulties."

DACCA, Bangladesh, Aug. 17 (AP)  Floods in Bangladesh have killed at least 10 people and have forced as many as 500,000 from their homes, according to reports reaching the capital today. All of the nation's major rivers were at dangerous levels, and officials predicted they will continue to rise sharply over the next 24 hours.

DACCA, Bangladesh, June 22 (Reuters)--Two people were killed and about 200 were injured today when supporters of rival soccer teams clashed in Dacca Stadium and the violence spread to nearby areas. Violence erupted an hour after the start of the game and ended with the mob throwing bricks, setting fire to cars and ransacking shops.

DACCA, Bangladesh, Oct. 27 (UPI)-- A bus with 100 passengers plowed through a crowded village market yesterday, killing 22 people and injuring 41, officials said today. They said brake failure had been blamed for the accident in Dagan Bhuyian, 100 miles south of here.

DACCA, Bangladesh, Nov. 23 (AP)-- Roads in an east-central district of Bangladesh adjacent to India have been closed for two days, after Indian border guards fired machine guns at two civilian trucks, Bangladesh authorities said today.

headline.main: Bangladesh District Says Roads Are Closed After Indian Shooting
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh District Says Roads Are Closed After Indian Shooting

docs.abstract: NEW DELHI, July 9 (AP)--Policemen charged into a crowd of 2,000 demonstrators today to clear roads to the main airport in the northeastern state of Assam, according to an Indian news agency report.

headline.main: Policemen Clear Roads in India Of Anti-Bangladeshi Protesters
headline.print_headline: Policemen Clear Roads in India Of Anti-Bangladeshi Protesters

docs.abstract: DACCA, Bangladesh, June 26 (AP)-- About 200 people were feared to have drowned tonight when a passenger launch collided with an oil tanker in the turbulent Meghna River, 20 miles from Dacca, officials reported.

headline.main: 200 Feared Drowned in Collision Of 2 Ships on River in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: 200 Feared Drowned in Collision Of 2 Ships on River in Bangladesh

headline.main: Bangladesh Snag Delays Naming of U.N.'s Iran Panel; Syria Announces Its Member
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Snag Delays Naming of U.N.'s Iran Panel; Syria Announces Its Member

byline.original: By Bernard D. Nossiter Special To the New York Times
